subject: Re: [junit] JUnit with MS JView?
msgSnippet: ...  ... Your CLASSPATH has a space in it. Bad news. Try placing quotation marks around it. Also: I seem to recall that JDK 1.1 does not including
messageBody:
Chris Morris wrote:

> I'm trying to run JUnit with Microsoft's jview (or wjview), and cannot
> get it working.

<snip />

> Maybe it's just not meant to be ... anyone ever get this to work?

Your CLASSPATH has a space in it. Bad news. Try placing quotation marks
around it.

Also: I seem to recall that JDK 1.1 does not including Swing. You need
to download Swing (1.0.3?) in order to use the "swingui" test runner.

Do understand that I haven't used JDK 1.1 since 1999, so I can't be
sure. I'm going by a relatively fuzzy memory.
--
J. B. Rainsberger,
Diaspar Software Services
